sense.name: the act of placing a monetary bet in a game of chance
sense.commentary: GAMBLE[+action][+betting][+money][+game][+chance] Note: refers specifically to placing money on bets of chance
sense.examples: John's gamble on red paid off two-to-one. This blackjack table requires players to make gambles of at least $100.

sense.name: the undertaking of any risky endeavor
sense.commentary: GAMBLE[+activity][+undertaking][+risky] Note: a broad extension of the narrower Sense 1 Note: does not imply directly betting money
sense.examples: Pete took the gamble and dropped out of school to start an Internet company. The senator warned that the war was a huge gamble with uncertain outcome.
